Posts.Content: EmmorsMom wrote: So I am 31yo and I just had my 2nd child 10 weeks ago. Breastfeeding didn't work but instead I have been pumping to provide for my little girl. On Monday I pumped a little more than usual. When I woke up Tuesday morning, my left breast was engorged, hot and painful. Nothing could touch it. I thought it was from too much pumping and went on my day. At lunch time, I felt the chills coming on and thought I might be getting the flu. Then I remembered the flu like symptoms of mastitis so I check my temp and it was 100.5. I decided to keep pumping and massaging and took some Tylenol for the fever. Felt decent Tues evening, but spent the whole night with chills and sweats. Wed morning I had a fever of 101.6 so I called the doc and they called in a prescription for some antibiotics. I've been taking them for 2 full days and things haven't improved. The engorgement went away a tiny bit and the fever is gone, but now the bottom of my breast is all red and kinda hard and thick feeling and my nipple is extremely Tender and sore and it puckers a little on the bottom part of the areola. I feel like there is a lump under the nipple but it hurts so much I can't tell. So bcuz it seemed to be getting worse, I called my doc & they had me come in. The doc looked & is concerned its an abscess. She wants me to try a different antibiotic over the weekend. If that doesn't work she wants me to schedule an appointment with a breast specialist to be seen on Monday morning in case they need to drain it. On another note the inside of my left elbow where the funny bone is has been very tender this week and I can feel a small lump when I put my elbow on a hard surface. I know there are lymph nodes in the elbow and that has me concerned. I mentioned it to my doctor and she just looked at my arm and felt it and said she would be concerned about blood clots but didn't see anything like that. Basically I'm concerned about IBC I know that mastitis is often diagnosed incorrectly. I was just wondering what you think of my situation & symptoms and if you have any advice. If its not better by Monday, do I mention ibc to the specialist? Mention the elbow pain? I've read you don't usually get fevers with IBC but who knows really? Any thoughts would be great. I'm really stressing out. My dad died last year of cancer and this is making me really concerned :( Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Worried it's IBC...any advice would help :( EmmorsMom redroks2

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2013 11:42PM EmmorsMom wrote: Thank you for responding. I don't want to "cry wolf". My biggest issue is that I have read studies and stories and blogs from women that thought they had mastitis and whose drs said it was mastitis and ended up with IBC. Lactating women & non lactating. I just feel like I don't know how far to push a dr to look into it...& I don't want to look back with regrets and think I should have asked... The puckered spot/hole on my nipple and the redness spreading from one small area to more skin under my nipple is what concerns me. The doctor said it shouldn't spread or get worse while on antibiotics for 2 days and it did...that's why they asked to see me. Anyways, I'm sorry for wasting people's time. I'll just see what they say on Monday. Thank you.
Posts.Title: Worried it's IBC...any advice would help :( EmmorsMom redroks2

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2013 02:32PM EmmorsMom wrote: Well now almost all of the redness is gone. I have no fever or any of that. The nipple is still sensitive and sometimes I have a lightning bolt like pain shoot from my nipple. The lump is still there under my areola. It's extremely tender & the size hasn't decreased. I've been on antibiotics for 5 days. I'm suppose to call the breast specialist in the morning to confirm whether I want the appointment or not. I just don't know. It doesn't look so horrible now, but that lumpy area under the areola & nipple concerns me. I've been pumping & if its a plugged duct or abscess it just won't go away. I just can't decide if I should see the specialist or wait...I don't want to take her time from other people...

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2013 06:50PM - edited Aug 20, 2013 06:53PM by EmmorsMom Well, the fever and redness are still gone. However, the lump under my areola is still there. Can a lump from mastitis hang around this long? It's been a week. And 6 days of antibiotics. The specialist's nurse said to finish the antibiotics & then call my Obgyn if it hadn't completely resolved. Pumping & heat are doing nothing :( I can't help but worry and be scared about that lump. So scared. I hate waiting :(

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2013 08:32AM EmmorsMom wrote: I feel the same way. Im 31 & My little one is 2 months old. I got mastitis almost 2 weeks ago and the antibiotics took away all the flu symptoms & redness, but a lump in my areola remains. The lump is stressing me out so much but I'm trying to wait until Monday when I'm all done with the Meds. But now every ache, pain, or weird feeling makes me worry and consult Dr. Google. Ugh. I wish I had more advice for you. I never even paid my breasts much attention until I started nursing, now it's all I think about!
Posts.Title: Feel like I'm becoming a hypochondriac Mom35 Mom35

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2013 12:38AM EmmorsMom wrote: Finally saw my Obgyn again today. She thinks the lump may be smaller. She said I could wait a week to see if it gets any smaller or she would send me to the specialist for an ultrasound. I think I want the appointment so I can find out what this is. Can cancer lumps shrink a little on their own? All mastitis symptoms are gone. Dr mentioned maybe an abscess but wouldn't that get worse & hurt? This doesn't hurt & I've been off antibiotics since Sunday. Its been 2 weeks with this lump. Just don't know how far to push it...
Posts.Title: Worried about a lump... EmmorsMom jocur5

Posts.Content: EmmorsMom wrote: I posted earlier as I was worried about IBC. I am 31yo and I had my second child about 10wks ago. Last tues I came down with mastitis...red, painful breast, fever and body aches. The dr prescribed antibiotics over the phone on Wed. I took them until Friday but the redness seemed to get worse so I went in. They switched my antibiotics & said they were worried about a abscess so they called in a referral to a specialist for Monday if it wasn't better. On Monday every symptom was gone except the lump so they said they didn't need to see me. I am very worried about the lump. It's right under the areola and sometimes I feel zinging pain. It can't be a plugged duct bcuz I've been working on getting it out for a week and nothing has changed. It doesn't hurt to touch at all so I can't imagine it's an abscess. I guess I just want to know when I should try to be seen again. I can't even be sure it wasn't there before mastitis. Should I go in again or wait longer? Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2013 05:17PM EmmorsMom wrote: Lump is still there...hubby says he thinks it's smaller, but I don't know. Tomorrow is my last day of antibiotics. If it's not gone by Monday morning, I am calling the doctor & pursuing this. At least maybe I can get some sleep.
Posts.Title: Worried about a lump... EmmorsMom jocur5

Posts.Content: EmmorsMom wrote: So I am 10wks post partum and I have been pumping only. Last Monday I pumped more than usual and Tues I woke up engorged & red & in pain. By lunch I had a fever & chills. I figured it was mastitis and hoped it might go away on its own. Wed morning was worse so I called the dr and they called in some antibiotics. They said to call in 2 days if not better. On Friday it seemed like the red spot had moved down and my areola was super tender, painful & red. If I touched it, it felt like there was a lump under the areola & nipple. So I called doc & they had me come in. The doctor was concerned about an abscess. She switched my antibiotics & called in a referral to a breast specialist for Monday. She said to head to the ER if it got worse over the weekend. She said to call tomorrow at 7:30am and either make or cancel the appt, depending on how it is. So I took the new antibiotic fri & sat. The redness has disappeared & most of the pain. I do get shooting lightning like zaps of pain coming from my nipple & its peeling. It's still tender and I can still feel that lump & thick area below the areola and nipple and that hasn't changed size. I'm just not sure if I should see the breast specialist or if I'm wasting someone's time. Ugh. I'm really stressing myself out over this. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump under areola & nipple EmmorsMom MelissaDallas
